info.name: VDU Mock Collection
info.description: Testing API for my Bachelor work...

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.

response.name: The success.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
The new auth key token.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).

response.name: Invalid X-API-Key.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).

item.name: Generate a new authorization token (key) for the first time.

header.description: (Required) The email address/username/etc. of the user making the request.

response.name: Invalid From and/or the user’s client secret

header.description: (Required) The email address/username/etc. of the user making the request.

body.raw: "'StrongClientSecret@123' //can be an empty in the case of client certificate/TLS authentication"

header.description: The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).

response.name: The success.

header.description: (Required) The email address/username/etc. of the user making the request.

body.raw: "'StrongClientSecret@123' //can be an empty in the case of client certificate/TLS authentication"

header.description: The new auth key token.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).
(Required) The last auth key token.

response.name: Invalid From and/or the user’s client secret.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).

response.name: The success.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).

item.name: Get the content of a file available by the given access token.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.

response.name: The success.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
Valid methods for a specified resource (GET for read-only, POST for write-only, GET POST for the ability to read multiple times and also write).
The type of encoding used on the data.
An alternate location for the returned data (a filename).
A Base64-encoded binary MD5 sum of the content of the response.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale so its new version cannot be posted (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).
The last modified date for the requested object (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).
An identifier for a specific version of a resource, i.e., a version number.

response.name: Invalid X-API-Key.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale so its new version cannot be posted (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).

response.name: The requested resource by the file-access-token could not be found.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale so its new version cannot be posted (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).

response.name: A request method is not supported for the requested resource, i.e., the resource is write-only (could be read before, but cannot be read now).

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale so its new version cannot be posted (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).

response.name: The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait for the upload.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale so its new version cannot be posted (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).

item.name: Post/upload the content of a file available by the given access token.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
(Required) The type of encoding used on the data.
(Required) The length of the request body in octets (8-bit bytes).
(Required) An alternate location for the data (a new filename if renamed by the client).
(Required) A Base64-encoded binary MD5 sum of the content of the request.
(Required) The MIME type of this content.

response.name: The success and the file access token remains valid.

header.description: (Required) The last auth key token.
(Required) The type of encoding used on the data.
(Required) The length of the request body in octets (8-bit bytes).
(Required) An alternate location for the data (a new filename if renamed by the client).
(Required) A Base64-encoded binary MD5 sum of the content of the request.
(Required) The MIME type of this content.
Valid methods for a specified resource (GET for read-only, POST for write-only, GET POST for the ability to read multiple times and also write).
The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale so its new version cannot be posted (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231).
An identifier for a specific version of a resource, i.e., a version number.

response.name: The success and the file access token was invalidated.

response.name: Indicates that the request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource, such as an edit conflict between multiple simultaneous updates.

item.name: To test a connection (to do a ping).

response.name: The server successfully processed the request, and is not returning any content.

header.description: The date and time at which the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).
